articles.headline: Trump and Republicans Bet Big on Anti-Trans Ads Across the Country
articles.snippet: Republicans have spent tens of millions of dollars on the ads, part of an attempt to help them win over suburban female voters.
articles.abstract: Republicans have spent tens of millions of dollars on the ads, part of an attempt to help them win over suburban female voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: With just four weeks until the election, Donald J. Trump and Republican candidates nationwide are putting transgender issues at the center of their campaigns, tapping into fears about transgender women and girls in sports and about taxpayer-funded gender transitions in prisons.

articles.headline: A New Bitcoin Documentary Reopens the Search for Satoshi Nakamoto
articles.snippet: The identity of the pseudonymous Bitcoin creator has eluded sleuths for years. But does finding the real Mr. Nakamoto really matter?
articles.abstract: The identity of the pseudonymous Bitcoin creator has eluded sleuths for years. But does finding the real Mr. Nakamoto really matter?
articles.lead_paragraph: There are two ambitious missions behind “Money Electric: The Bitcoin Mystery,” a new documentary by the filmmaker Cullen Hoback that was released Tuesday by HBO.

articles.headline: Trump Family Business Eyes Hotel Deals in Israel
articles.snippet: The Trump Organization was in talks about Israeli hotels before the Hamas attack last year. It says it wants to resume them in the future, raising questions about the mingling of politics and money in the event of a second Trump term.
articles.abstract: The Trump Organization was in talks about Israeli hotels before the Hamas attack last year. It says it wants to resume them in the future, raising questions about the mingling of politics and money in the event of a second Trump term.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the heart of Jerusalem, a short walk from the Israeli Supreme Court and prime minister’s office, Donald J. Trump’s family business spotted a moneymaking opportunity.
articles.byline: By Debra Kamin, Steve Eder and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Inside the Battle for America’s Most Consequential Battleground State
articles.snippet: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are pouring more money, time and energy into Pennsylvania than anywhere else, waging an ad war as they crisscross the state.
articles.abstract: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are pouring more money, time and energy into Pennsylvania than anywhere else, waging an ad war as they crisscross the state.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Vice President Kamala Harris rolled out her economic agenda, she went to Pittsburgh. When she unveiled her running mate, she went to Philadelphia. And when she had to pick a place for Barack Obama’s first fall rally this Thursday, it was back to Pittsburgh.

articles.headline: Months Before Ethiopian Crash, Boeing Turned Aside Carrier’s Questions
articles.snippet: Ethiopian Airlines appeared to foresee the deadly confusion its pilots would face if flawed software in the Boeing 737 Max failed. Boeing chose not to provide the guidance that the carrier was seeking.
articles.abstract: Ethiopian Airlines appeared to foresee the deadly confusion its pilots would face if flawed software in the Boeing 737 Max failed. Boeing chose not to provide the guidance that the carrier was seeking.
articles.lead_paragraph: In late 2018, Ethiopian Airlines’ chief pilot sent an urgent message to Boeing, the manufacturer of the 737 Max airliner.
articles.byline: By Mark Walker and James Glanz
